text: - In this episode, we will discuss the use

of a server-side rendering
architecture pattern

to improve the performance and
SEO of your web applications.
First, a front-end web application
and its assets could live in a S3 bucket.
In order to make the website faster,

you add a content delivery
network, like Amazon CloudFront,

to ensure fast global
delivery to your customers
and cache the contents when needed.
Then, to make it marketable and secure,
you have to manage DNS
and SSL certificates for your domain name
through services like Amazon Route 53
and AWS Certificate Manager.
Then you need to manage APIs
and server-side compute layers
through services, like AWS Lambda,

to fetch data from databases,
content management system,
and third-party APIs,
and compile the data into a static HTML.

For the developers, if
they want to commit code

to a Git Repository, like
CodeCommit, GitHub, or GitLab,

they need to have a
continuous build, test,
and delivery process to push these assets.

You can use this
architectural pattern to build
and deploy an SSR web application,
or choose to use a managed service,
like AWS Amplify Hosting,

that abstracts all these
components away from you

to easily build and host
SSR-based web applications
in an accelerated manner.
